entry.title: Bash Shell Basics
entry.content:
Notes from the Pluralsight course Introduction to the Bash Shell on Mac OS and Linux

Braces

ls file?{mine,yours}.{txt,png}

Commands

grep 1978 oscars.tsv | sort > 1978_films.txt cut -f 3 oscars.tsv | grep 4 | wc -l

Sort second column as numbers in reverse order sort -rnk2 math_grades

Unique entries with their count sort math_attendance | uniq -c | sort -nr

Find the largest file in the directory ls -lS | head -n 2 | tail -n 1 ls -lrS | tail -n 2 # Better way

Don't exit but update as new entries come in tail -f auth.log

Number of files in a directory ls -a | wc -l

Search for bruce, case insensitive, in a set of files grep -i bruce *grades

Filter out using an extended regex before working with other content grep -Ev "^$|lecture" math_attendance | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr

Search for txt files with curious in them find . -name '*.txt' -exec grep -l curious {} \;

Change uppercase 'S' to lowercase 's' cat physics_grades | tr S s tr S s < physics_grades # More efficient method

Change from tab separated to semicolon separated tr \\t \; < oscars.tsv > oscars.csv

Using sed sed 's/something/something new/g' one.txt > two.txt

Combine files using columns (not append) paste *grades join *grades # Using keys

Command Substitution

echo "hello `whoami`" #old form echo "Buy milk" > "notes$(date).txt"

Copy / Paste

Select text and paste with middle mouse click

Movement keys

  • ctrl-a: start of line
  • ctrl-e: end of line
  • ctrl-f: forward 1 char
  • ctrl-b: backward 1 char
  • alt-f: forward 1 word
  • alt-b: backward 1 word
  • ctrl-d: delete 1 char
  • ctrl-h: delete 1 char backward
  • alt-d: delete 1 word
  • ctrl-w: delete 1 word backward
  • ctrl-k: delete rest of line
  • ctrl-u: delete from start of line
  • ctrl-r: search back in history

Processes

  • C-z: stop and return to a command prompt
    • fg or bg to start the process again
    • or use the job id: fg %1
  • jobs: to list the running jobs
  • kill %1: kill job 1
  • or by process id
    • ps -ef: list all processes and show the owner
    • kill 1234

Customization

  • alias: view aliases
  • \ls: run normal command, not the alias for it
  • .bashrc: executed for non-login shells
  • .profile or .bash_profile: executed for login shells
  • echo $PS1: reading an environment variable
  • PS1="\h:\W /u": set an environment variable
  • env: list all environment variables
  • EDITOR=vim: set the editor
  • export EDITOR: to make it visible
    • or export EDITOR=vim
  • chsh: change shell
    • \bin\zsh: change to using zsh
  • echo $SHELL: view current shell
